description: Traditional use of earthen clay pots to store drinking water and keep it naturally cool during summer without electricity.
steps: Select a clean, unglazed clay pot.
Fill the pot with clean drinking water.
Place the pot in a shaded area to prevent direct sunlight.
Allow the water to cool naturally through evaporation.
risks: Potential contamination if the pot is not cleaned properly
Water may become warm if not placed in a shaded area
